alert.note: Alert for Coke; Concho; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coke, northeastern Tom Green, southern Runnels and northwestern Concho Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1056 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harriet, or near Orient, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Ballinger, Paint Rock, Maverick, Miles, Lowake, Orient, Norton, Grape Creek, Mereta, Veribest, Vancourt, Eola, Tennyson, Rowena, Water Valley, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1929, Ballinger Lake and Us-83 Near The Concho- Runnels County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
